meta.axiom: Belief ≠ truth; every belief has confidence, decay, and authority

layers.name: Bedrock
layers.meaning: Do we know the ground we stand on?

layers.name: Growth
layers.meaning: Is the system alive and healthy?

layers.name: Atmosphere

principles: Belief ≠ truth; every belief has confidence, decay, and authority
Irreversible actions require higher epistemic confidence
Unknowns must be named, bounded, and monitored

gates.name: Problem Legitimacy
gates.question: Do we know the problem actually exists?
required_evidence: Written problem statement with falsifiable claims
At least one external signal (user, market, operational pain)
epistemic_checks: Confidence score assigned to problem existence
Known biases listed (founder bias, availability bias)
do_not_proceed_if: Problem is defined only by internal belief
No evidence survives a skeptical reading
"Everyone knows this is a problem" is the justification
gates.evidence_notes: Ceramicists need accessible chemistry tools. Validated by NCECA interest, Glazy user base, Insight-Live market existence.

gates.name: User & Stakeholder Reality
gates.question: Do we know who experiences the problem and how?
required_evidence: Identified user classes with authority boundaries
Primary vs secondary users explicitly separated
gates.evidence_notes: 4 user classes: hobby potters (free), studio potters (solo), professional ceramicists (pro), researchers/educators (atlas_3d/edu). Blind spot: researcher segment under-characterized.

gates.name: Requirements Truth
gates.question: Are requirements grounded in reality rather than desire?
required_evidence: Functional requirements traceable to user evidence
epistemic_checks: Each requirement tagged: observed / inferred / assumed
gates.evidence_notes: Core (UMF calc, Stull chart, material DB) = observed. 3D explorer = inferred. AI suggestions = assumed.

gates.name: Feasibility & Capability
gates.question: Can this be built with known constraints?
required_evidence: Capability map (what the system can / cannot do)
gates.evidence_notes: Plotly 3D proven. Supabase proven. Stripe proven. Netlify proven. No unproven core dependencies.

gates.name: Architectural Truth
gates.question: Does the architecture reflect operational reality?
gates.evidence_notes: Client-side SPA + Supabase backend. State ownership clear. Trust boundary: Supabase RLS. Rollback: git revert + Netlify rollback.

gates.name: Implementation Safety
gates.question: Is code doing only what we believe it does?
gates.evidence_notes: 269/269 tests passing. 0 TS errors. Gap: no failure injection tests yet.

gates.name: Pre-Release Truth
gates.question: Does reality match our beliefs so far?
do_not_proceed_if: Known issues are waived without mitigation
gates.evidence_notes: Performance not load-tested. Supabase RLS needs audit. Accessibility not formally validated. Rollback plan exists (Netlify).
gaps: No security audit of RLS policies

gates.name: Launch Authorization
gates.question: Are we justified in exposing others to this system?
gates.evidence_notes: Only Netlify analytics. No error tracking. No incident response plan. Support = Ryan only.
gaps: Single point of failure: Ryan as sole support

gates.name: Operational Belief Management
gates.question: Are we updating beliefs from reality continuously?
gates.evidence_notes: No telemetry. No belief decay modeling. No drift detection.
gaps: No feedback loop from production to beliefs

gates.name: Iteration & Change
gates.question: Are changes epistemically reversible?
do_not_proceed_if: No rollback or feature flag exists
gates.evidence_notes: Git-level reversibility. No runtime feature flags. No experiment isolation.

gates.name: Sunset & Exit
gates.question: Can we end this without epistemic harm?
gates.evidence_notes: No data export. No transition plan. No knowledge archive strategy.

steps: If ANY do-not-proceed is TRUE → gate FAILS
Record confidence score, known gaps, and decision
Post to Context DB with gate_impact
Submit to Howell for final authorization (on irreversible gates)
